            <gmd:abstract>
                <gco:CharacterString>Ducks Unlimited Canada’s (DUC) mission is to conserve, restore, and manage wetlands to benefit waterfowl, wildlife, and people. DUC has restored and secured over 45,000 acres of habitat in Nova Scotia (NS) through restoration, conservation, research, and education. This project was to assess the health and biodiversity of 5 rural community wetlands, as well as 1 urban community wetland all located in NS. Since 2003, DUC has been conducting wetland field trips for Grade 4 students at several wetlands in NS. Each year DUC employs 1-2 youth to assist with the delivery of this program and over time we have noticed changes in the biodiversity and potentially the water quality of these wetlands. Therefore, the goal of this project was to assess the health of these wetland sites during the Grade 4 wetland field trips, as well as other times throughout the summer months.</gco:CharacterString>
            </gmd:abstract>

name: 10-25976-yfnq-nh05
notes: Ducks Unlimited Canada’s (DUC) mission is to conserve, restore, and manage wetlands to benefit waterfowl, wildlife, and people. DUC has restored and secured over 45,000 acres of habitat in Nova Scotia (NS) through restoration, conservation, research, and education. This project was to assess the health and biodiversity of 5 rural community wetlands, as well as 1 urban community wetland all located in NS. Since 2003, DUC has been conducting wetland field trips for Grade 4 students at several wetlands in NS. Each year DUC employs 1-2 youth to assist with the delivery of this program and over time we have noticed changes in the biodiversity and potentially the water quality of these wetlands. Therefore, the goal of this project was to assess the health of these wetland sites during the Grade 4 wetland field trips, as well as other times throughout the summer months.

notes_translated.en: Ducks Unlimited Canada’s (DUC) mission is to conserve, restore, and manage wetlands to benefit waterfowl, wildlife, and people. DUC has restored and secured over 45,000 acres of habitat in Nova Scotia (NS) through restoration, conservation, research, and education. This project was to assess the health and biodiversity of 5 rural community wetlands, as well as 1 urban community wetland all located in NS. Since 2003, DUC has been conducting wetland field trips for Grade 4 students at several wetlands in NS. Each year DUC employs 1-2 youth to assist with the delivery of this program and over time we have noticed changes in the biodiversity and potentially the water quality of these wetlands. Therefore, the goal of this project was to assess the health of these wetland sites during the Grade 4 wetland field trips, as well as other times throughout the summer months.
notes_translated.fr: La mission de Ducks Unlimited Canada (DUC) est de conserver, de restaurer et de gérer les zones humides au profit de la sauvagine, de la faune et des humains. Le DUC a restauré et sécurisé plus de 45 000 acres d'habitat en Nouvelle-Écosse (NS) grâce à la restauration, à la conservation, à la recherche et à l'éducation. Ce projet visait à évaluer la santé et la biodiversité de 5 zones humides communautaires rurales, ainsi que d'une zone humide communautaire urbaine, toutes situées en Nouvelle-Écosse. Depuis 2003, le DUC organise des excursions scolaires pour les élèves de 4e année dans plusieurs zones humides de la Nouvelle-Écosse. Chaque année, le DUC emploie 1 à 2 jeunes pour aider à la mise en œuvre de ce programme et, au fil du temps, nous avons remarqué des changements dans la biodiversité et potentiellement dans la qualité de l'eau de ces zones humides. Par conséquent, l'objectif de ce projet était d'évaluer l'état de santé de ces zones humides lors des excursions sur le terrain dans les zones humides de 4e année, ainsi qu'à d'autres moments pendant les mois d'été.

notes_translation_method.fr: Description text translated using the Amazon translate service / texte traduit à l'aide du service Amazon translate

description_translated.en: DataStream is an open access platform for sharing water and sediment quality data.
description_translated.fr: DataStream est une plateforme en libre accès pour partager des données sur la qualité de l'eau et des sédiments.

title: RBC Future Launch Water Quality Monitoring

title_translated.en: RBC Future Launch Water Quality Monitoring
title_translated.fr: RBC Future lance un programme de surveillance de la qualité de l'eau
